definition: seriously injured
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
to injure/injury/wound

sentences.english: Poor Barry stopped a packet when his car was in collision with a lorry.
sentences.chinese: 巴里的车与一辆卡车相撞，可怜的巴里身负重伤。

sentences.english: He received severe injuries and nearly lost his life during the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 在第二次世界大战期间他身负重伤险些丧命。

sentences.english: Imperial search teams found Dodonna's wounded body and took the officer captive.
sentences.chinese: 帝国搜索队找到身负重伤的多登纳，俘虏了这位军官。

sentences.english: Despite his terrible injuries, he wouldn't give up the struggle for life.
sentences.chinese: 他尽管身负重伤，但仍然没有放弃求生的努力。

sentences.english: Poor John stopped a packet when his car was in collision with a lorry.
sentences.chinese: 约翰的车与一辆卡车相撞，可怜的约翰身负重伤。

sentences.english: He was seriously injured after a fight with General Grievous on Boz Pity.
sentences.chinese: 他在博兹皮蒂与格里弗斯将军的战斗中身负重伤。

sentences.english: Small brightness load personally in construction.
sentences.chinese: 小辉在一次施工中身负重伤。

sentences.english: Although he was seriously wounded, he flatly refused to quit the battle line.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然身负重伤，但坚决不下火线。
另一个美军士兵则身负重伤。

sentences.english: Arthur killed Modred in battle but he himself was badly wounded.
sentences.chinese: 亚瑟杀死莫德雷德，自己也身负重伤。

to die/to perish
